Intervention: The group will only receive clinical management treatment each session.

Clinical management: Clinical management is a clear contrasting method of psychological therapy, which is a semi-structured interview and lasts 20 to 25 minutes at each session. Clinical management will be attributed to both the experimental group and the controlled group at the first stage of the intervention.
The following are the main elements:

Discuss with subjects to find their main problems; introduce knowledge and knowledge of drugs about cancer and depression; subjects who report using cancer and depression drugs and a variety of signs and symptoms of the reaction; encourage patients to adhere to and comply with drug treatment; The functioning of CBT and clinical management should be conducted by the same person to the extent possible.
The experimental group will receive the CBT each session.

Subjects will receive regular standardized CBT treatment for 9 sessions (once a week in the first month and once a half a month in the second and third months), and each session will last about 60 minutes.The treatment consists of three stages:Design stage (first and second sessions): development of therapeutic relationships with subjects; Development of skills and repetition stage (third session at the eighth session): clarification of sources of stress, cognitive and behavioural response of patients to stress.
Eligibility: • Patients with pathologically diagnosed breast cancer, with the diagnosis of at least 2 complete clinical treating physicians, in accordance with the clinical diagnosis of breast cancer;
One week after breast cancer surgery;
With complaints and symptoms of depression or anxiety
HAMD-17 8 points or / and HAMA 8 points;
Have literacy skills (could complement the self-assessment scale independently or with the help of others);
Previous diagnosis of mental disorder or bipolar disorder; history of alcohol and drug abuse;
Use antidepressants, antipsychotics or accept any form of psychological treatment, or participate in other clinical trials in the last month
• Patients with cardiovascular disease, liver and kidney dysfunction and other serious diseases;
A hearing, visual or understanding impairment;
- May not or may not comply with physician-based clinical treatment programs
Persons who failed to meet their obligations during the trial period;
People whose depression has increased during the trial period, have serious suicidal tendencies and require urgent intervention;
People who are believed to have other circumstances and who should be suspended by doctors
Results: The scale (HAMD-17) is used to assess symptoms of depression in patients.
The range of scales is 0-53.The higher value represents a worse result.
The scale was evaluated at baseline,2 weeks,4 weeks,8 weeks,12 weeks,16 weeks,24 weeks
